availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Kinchen Battoe (Trigg County, Kentucky, surveyor and fugitive - forger)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, surveyor and fugitive. Kentucky native. Son of James Battoe and Elizabeth Tart Battoe. Married to Tabitha Johnston Battoe in 1836. Father of Mary A. Battoe Cheatham, James J. Battoe, Teresa E. Battoe, John K. Battoe, Alpha E. Battoe, William F. Battoe, and Franklin Battoe. Surveyor in Trigg County, Kentucky in 1850. Employed James Battoe, Jr., as a laborer in Trigg County in 1850. Fugitive reported to be in Tennessee in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 359B.
